quote: Nothing in biology makes sense except in the light of evolution.
author: Theodosius Dobzhansky

quote: I believe in evolution in the sense that a short-tempered man is the successor of a crybaby.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: The evolution revolution is here. Global sense makes common sense.
author: Judah Freed,  GLOBAL SENSE

quote: Genetics might be adequate for explaining microevolution, but microevolutionary changes in gene frequency were not seen as able to turn a reptile into a mammal or to convert a fish into an amphibian. Microevolution looks at adaptations that concern the survival of the fittest, not the arrival of the fittest... The origin of species — Darwin’s problem — remains unsolved.
author: Scott F. Gilbert

quote: Evolution of Love [10w] Love evolved from when one monkey handed another a blossom.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: When man becomes greater than nature, nature, which gave us birth, will respond.
author: Loren Eiseley

quote: The best place to start the evolution of the vertebrates is the imagination.
author: Homer W. Smith

quote: Creativity sparks originality which then manifests itself into what we call evolution. To depreciate imagination is to depreciate life.
author: Alecia Stone

quote: We have become, by the power of a glorious evolutionary accident called intelligence, the stewards of life's continuity on earth. We did not ask for this role, but we cannot abjure it. We may not be suited to it, but here we are.
author: Stephen Jay Gould,  The Flamingo's Smile: Reflections in Natural History

quote: You will evolve past certain people. Let yourself.
author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass

quote: Choosing kindness is the ultimate expression of evolved consciousness. Grow by being kind.
author: Amy Leigh Mercree

quote: Folks, it's time to evolve. That's why we're troubled. You know why our institutions are failing us, the church, the state, everything's failing? It's because, um – they're no longer relevant. We're supposed to keep evolving. Evolution did not end with us growing opposable thumbs. You do know that, right?
author: Bill Hicks

quote: Consciousness-Driven Evolution circa 60,000 B.C. Random genetic mutation allowed homo sapiens to compete more successfully for food and mating rights. Just listen to girl chatter posted on the cave walls:"Boy, Uggh is hot. He's sentient!""Yeah. He doesn't need a club to get my attention.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Life is neither static nor unchanging. With no individuality, there can be no change, no adaptation and, in an inherently changing world, any species unable to adapt is also doomed.
author: Jean M. Auel

quote: I am quite sure that our views on evolution would be very different had biologists studied genetics and natural selection before and not after most of them were convinced that evolution had occurred.
author: J.B.S. Haldane

quote: The most telling and profound way of describing the evolution of the universe would undoubtedly be to trace the evolution of love.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quote: The greatest untold story is the evolution of God.
author: G.I. Gurdjieff

quote: The idea that one can go to the fossil record and expect to empirically recover an ancestor-descendant sequence, be it of species, genera, families, or whatever, has been, and continues to be, a pernicious illusion.
author: Gareth J. Nelson

quote: Even if it were true that evolution, or the teaching of evolution, encouraged immorality that would not imply that the theory of evolution was false.
author: Richard Dawkins,  The Greatest Show on Earth: The Evidence for Evolution

quote: The Theory of Evolution has more holes in it than a dam made out of Swiss cheese.
author: Eoin Colfer,  The Time Paradox

quote: we attract what is happening in our lives
author: Rhonda Byrne,  The Secret

quote: Reinvent new combinations of what you already own. Improvise. Become more creative. Not because you have to, but because you want to. Evolution is the secret for the next step.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: Man must evolve for all human conflict a method which rejects revenge, aggression and retaliation. The foundation of such a method is love.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Science, like life, feeds on its own decay. New facts burst old rules; then newly divined conceptions bind old and new together into a reconciling law.
author: William James,  The Will to Believe and Other Essays in Popular Philosophy

quote: Maybe if I had to boil it down to one easy sentence, it would be this: I believe in evolution, and I believe in God. I just haven't worked out the details yet.
author: Robin Brande,  Evolution, Me & Other Freaks of Nature

quote: The ideology and philosophy of neo-Darwinism which is sold by its adepts as a scientific theoretical foundation of biology seriously hampers the development of science and hides from students the field’s real problems.
author: Vladimir L. Voeikov

quote: Evolution does not necessarily favor the longest-lived. It doesn't necessarily favor the biggest or the strongest or the fastest, and not even the smartest. Evolution favors those creatures best adapted to their environment. That is the sole test of survival and success.
author: Harvey V. Fineberg

quote: Nature is the art of God.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: We are survival machines – robot vehicles blindly programmed to preserve the selfish molecules known as genes. This is a truth which still fills me with astonishment.
author: Richard Dawkins,  The Selfish Gene

quote: Through learning we re-create ourselves. Through learning we become able to do something we never were able to do. Through learning we reperceive the world and our relationship to it. Through learning we extend our capacity to create, to be part of the generative process of life
author: Peter M. Senge

quote: Don't assume the world evolved in the order in which you discovered it.
author: Raymond E. Feist

quote: Like nature, we must grow with tranquility, beauty, harmony, and love.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Let us try to teach generosity and altruism, because we are born selfish. Let us understand what our own selfish genes are up to, because we may then at least have the chance to upset their designs, something that no other species has ever aspired to do.
author: Richard Dawkins,  The Selfish Gene

quote: As we go through life we gradually discover who we are, but the more we discover, the more we lose ourselves.
author: Haruki Murakami,  Colorless Tsukuru Tazaki and His Years of Pilgrimage

quote: Every existing thing is born without reason, prolongs itself out of weakness, and dies by chance.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: The alternative to thinking in evolutionary terms is not to think at all.
author: Peter Medawar

quote: Our awareness about ourselves and the world around us is so limited that we are ready to destroy ourselves. For the survival of humanity, an evolution of consciousness is essential.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: No matter what argument you make against evolution, the response is Well, you know, it's possible to believe in evolution and believe in God. Yes, and it's possible to believe in Spiderman and believe in God, but that doesn't prove Spiderman is true.
author: Ann Coulter,  Godless: The Church of Liberalism

quote: Science cannot solve the ultimate mystery of nature. And that is because, in the last analysis, we ourselves are a part of the mystery that we are trying to solve.
author: Max Planck,  Where is Science Going?

quote: The greatest discovery of any generation is that a human can alter his life by altering his attitude.
author: William James

quote: In the end, nature is inexorable: it has no reason to hurry and, sooner or later, it takes what belongs to it. Unconsciously and inflexibly obedient to its own laws, it doesn't know art, just as it doesn't know freedom, just as it doesn't know goodness.
author: Ivan Turgenev

quote: It's amazing to me that we humans have the intellectual capacity to ask deep questions and to devise methods for learning how the universe works and how its contents evolve with time.
author: Alex Filippenko

quote: life is a continous journey of transformation
author: Sukant Ratnakar,  Open the Windows

quote: If the history-deniers who doubt the fact of evolution are ignorant of biology, those who think the world began less than ten thousand years ago are worse than ignorant, they are deluded to the point of perversity. They are denying not only the facts of biology but those of physics, geology, cosmology, archaeology, history and chemistry as well.
author: Richard Dawkins,  The Greatest Show on Earth: The Evidence for Evolution

quote: Our great human adventure is the evolution of consciousness. We are in this life to enlarge the soul, liberate the spirit, and light up the brain.
author: Tom Robbins,  Wild Ducks Flying Backward

quote: We choose our next world through what we learn in this one. Learn nothing, and the next world is the same as this one, all the same limitations and lead weights to overcome.
author: Richard Bach,  Jonathan Livingston Seagull

quote: Life comes from the earth and life returns to the earth.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: We are biology. We are reminded of this at the beginning and the end, at birth and at death. In between we do what we can to forget.
author: Mary Roach,  Stiff: The Curious Lives of Human Cadavers

quote: I didn't want a world in which I had to choose between blind human babies and tortured monkey ones. To be frank, that's the sort of choice I expect science to protect me from, not give me.
author: Karen Joy Fowler,  We Are All Completely Beside Ourselves

quote: We adore chaos because we love to produce order.
author: M. C. Escher
